author: sky.cactus
content: Did we resolve the Kiln transition problem from yesterday?

author: kedos25.eth
content: Im not sure if this is the problem you referring to, but Prsym produced bad blocks caused by a big vs. little endian issue in handling baseFeePerGas. The bugs are already fixed by the team.

author: sky.cactus
content: Was that the only issue from the transition?  I stopped following before everything was figured out, and at the time it wasn't clear if there were multiple problems or not.

author: chfast
content: About the Merge -> Paris rename. I'm glad this is resolved, but this is very late to decide on names. In my projects I'm already using Cancun for the upgrade after Shanghai. I will change the name to Paris but I wander if other projects will do (e.g. geth, tests).

author: axic3354
content: Isn't it London, (Arrow Glacier), Paris, Shanghai now? Where Paris is out of order, because the first Paris conf (EDCON) was after Shanghai? üò¨

author: chfast
content: I'm using Cancun to prototype some EIPs that are too late for Shanghai. Could be named Experimental too. I just wanted to note that these names are introduced to code quite early in the process. So it has more value to know the names up front.

author: axic3354
content: Shanghai (feature fork) could still launch before Paris (merge), right <@!552133098075193354>? üòÖ

author: bridge-bot
content: <timbeiko> That seems incredibly unlikely, no? We‚Äôd have to find something _so_ wrong with The Merge that we think it will take several quarters to fix, and then decide that getting Shanghai out is a better way forward...

author: gcolvin
content: Not just unlikely, but a fate we are working very hard to avoid.
